trigger_event: Lenart Kova stumbles upon a hidden cache in Halden’s datacenter vault, containing both sealed Council reports on Halden’s death and Halden’s hand-drawn spiral diagrams — but can only release one or the other without leaving a trace.
dilemma: Choose to leak either the Council’s secret reports, confirming high-level deception and causing a public reckoning, or release Halden’s spiral blueprints, inspiring a new model for citizen assembly and governance. Both choices will set the city on a distinctly different path.
reason: Lenart is unsure because both options will reshape the city dramatically: exposing the truth could unleash chaos and anger, while offering a hopeful framework risks letting the Council escape consequences. His maintenance access makes him the only one able to act without immediate detection.
choice_a: Leak the sealed Council reports, exposing the Council’s lies about Halden’s death and causing civic outrage and demands for a reckoning.
belief_a: Truth matters more than stability, even if it breaks things open.
Leadership must answer for its crimes publicly.
Real change starts with confronting the ugliest facts first.
choice_b: Release Halden’s spiral diagrams and instructions, launching new assemblies and a wave of creative city renewal inspired by a different vision for governance.
belief_b: A future must be built, not just burned down.
Giving people a new way forward is kinder than giving just the painful truth.
If hope is seeded wisely, the city can reinvent itself instead of fracturing completely.
